verses.roman:
kharo ’śvo ’śvataro gauraḥ
śarabhaś camarī tathā
ete caika-śaphāḥ kṣattaḥ
śṛṇu pañca-nakhān paśūn

synonyms: kharaḥ—ass; aśvaḥ—horse; aśvataraḥ—mule; gauraḥ—white deer; śarabhaḥ—bison; camarī—wild cow; tathā—thus; ete—all these; ca—and; eka—only one; śaphāḥ—hoof; kṣattaḥ—O Vidura; śṛṇu—just hear now; pañca—five; nakhān—nails; paśūn—animals.
translation: The horse, mule, ass, gaura, śarabha bison and wild cow all have only one hoof. Now you may hear from me about the animals who have five nails.
